title: Subhojit‚Äôs Academic Journey
text:
Where do my interest lie?
Too early to state my interest in a particular subject. But, yeah I like problems that require a certain depth of thoughts. I also like to read about how macrostates and microstates relate to each other.


What are hobbies?
I prefer reading in solitary and listening to music. I also like to enagge myself in football(Favourite Club - Mohun Bagan) and watching movies.


Some special quotes that changed my life

The quote says, you only need to only one thing in this universe. It may be absurd and irrelevant at first sight but observe how it actually relates to the present world and its progression. We are actually heading to a world where one might need to only one thing(unified subject) to solve all the problems.

title: LaTeX Styling
text:
Story Time üòÅ
I had to work on the UDGRP Projects of Winter 2024 and there I had to use a lot of latex and make Beamer files and Latex Notes and while there were ample number of templates on OverLeaf but it seemed too boring and it lacked the personal touch I wanted to give to my presentations. So, I decided to create my own sty theme and customize it according to my preferences. üòÑ

title: LaTeX Styling
text:
FAQ üòï

Q. How do I use them ?






üöÄ Simple Steps to Get Started






1. Download the Files
Head over to the GitHub repository and download the .sty files. You can either clone the repository or directly download the files you need.


2. Place the Files in Your Project
Move the .sty files to the same directory as your LaTeX project (where your .tex file resides) or a folder included in your LaTeX path.


3. Include the .sty Files in Your Document
To use the .sty file, include it in your LaTeX document with the \usepackage command.
Example Files - - - GitHub repository










üí° Pro Tip





If you‚Äôre frequently using these .sty files, consider adding them to your LaTeX distribution‚Äôs local path for easy access across all your projects.
